intro: Agarista stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf agarista, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. Agarista stenophylla is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
